metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32746 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Samba AD LDAP server. The AD DC database auditlogging module can access LDAP message values freed by a preceding databasemodule, resulting in a use-after-free issue. This issue is only possiblewhen modifying certain privileged attributes, such as userAccountControl.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldb-tools - 2:2.4.4-0ubuntu0.1
libldb2 - 2:2.4.4-0ubuntu0.1
python3-ldb - 2:2.4.4-0ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

ctdb - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
libnss-winbind - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
libpam-winbind - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
libsmbclient - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
libwbclient0 - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
python3-samba - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
registry-tools - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-common - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-common-bin - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-libs - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-testsuite - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
smbclient - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
winbind - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ldb package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.4.4-0ubuntu0.1').
samba package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2').
